body: There are  customers that still use JDK 7 as the platforms.     Building with JDK 7 does not preclude use of JDK 8 as the runtime platform.   So, we should defer until there is a real need to change the source compatibility to JDK 8
+1. Thanks
@pallavi-rao @ajayyadava  : When will this script be committed? Please let us know if you have ETA
ðŸ‘

Based on response given by @vramachan , the code looks good and does what is expected. Please update the documentation as well to say that user should enable Oozie JMS notification. Once documentation is provided the code looks good.
+1 once you address comments by @yzheng-hortonworks
@bvellanki : Thanks for the review!
+1 after updating documentation as suggested by @bvellanki

@yzheng-hortonworks : There are two ways of handling it.
1> Instead of adding by default to Extension CLI it can be added only to commands which honor it. That way by default if unsupported option is passed it will throw exception. This is how it is handled today in the code
2> Other way is to handle in specific commands

As your code is in accordance with the current design I will give a ship ti. We can revisit this if required in the future. Thanks!

Thanks @sowmyaramesh . Yes, and this would be a lot of work, since every CLI command only validates required parameters but not unsupported ones. We need to change every CLI command to make it happen.

@sowmyaramesh Thanks for working on this. Just want to know , is it possible to simplify the packaging statements by copying extensions related files to hdfs-mirroring, hive-mirroring and hdfs-snapshot-mirroring respectively instead of having META, build and runtime directory. For any specific jar we can have lib directory under respective extensions.

@peeyushb : don't understand your comment. Idea is to maintain the extension store structuring so it should packaged in this way so that Ambari can automate copying extensions packaged in Falcon to extension uri on HDFS.

```
ExtensionUri
|-- Extension1
    |-- README
    |-- META
    |-- libs
        |-- build
        |-- runtime
    |-- resources
        |-- build
        |-- runtime
```

+1
Thanks @sowmyaramesh   - When I first ran with testpatch, some unrelated tests failed - cleaned up env and revalidated

@sowmyaramesh I just wanted to say that, is it possible to simplify the extension directory structure as below rather having META, resources, build, runtime directory 

```
ExtensionUri
|-- Extension1
    |-- libs
    |-- Extension1-properties.json
    |-- Extension1-template.xml
    |-- Extension1-workflow.xml
```

Please help me to understand about the purpose of having META, build and runtime directory.

@peeyushb : Please refer FALCON-634. Having a definitive directory structure helps. In future when custom extensions are implemented extension store dir structure will be self explanatory to the user.

I am giving +1 with the following comments:   Let us fix the minor verifySafemode argument fix so that we are future proof
Let us add JIRA to add versions to other entities.   We initially wanted to have internal managed versions but having exposed them in cluster entity, we should do for others.
Thanks @vrangan for reviewing the pull request. Pull request has been updated after incorporating the review comments.
Thank @bvellanki .  I think It would be better to separate out pom fixes with CHANGELOG changes and comment changes for easier tracking

@vrangan  : Fair point about changelog, I will remove it. I think the comment fix should stay in since the build fails with test-patch profile. Please let me know if this is ok and I will make the changes.
@vrangan @peeyushb @yzheng-hortonworks  : Latest patch includes all feedback you provided.
Patch looks good. +1 .
Agreed.  It was not clear why the second fix was there.   Thanks for pointing out.  +1 after removing changelog

Thanks for doing this.   Add a unit testcase for the credential providing alias resolution - Please see TestPassingSecurePassword#testCredentialProviderLoader and TestPassingSecurePassword#testPasswordAliasOption in Sqoop

In fact, we no longer need the reflection mechanisms as Falcon is now using Hadoop 2.6+
Also, let us add a documentation for this

It looks like multicommit pull requests don't apply if we get a patch - works ok if we do the final diff
+1  - The build failures are unrelated.

+1. Thank you for addressing this, @PraveenAdlakha . Verified that this error fixed. However, I still got another error when it tries to create a directory for Derby DB (see below). Could you make the default setting work without extra Derby configuration (i.e. user can start Falcon without setting up Derby DB themselves)? One example is the embedded ActiveMQ server which we provide by default.

Caused by: ERROR XBM0H: Directory /usr/hdp/2.4.0.0-169/falcon-0.10-SNAPSHOT/target/test-data/data.db cannot be created.
    at org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException.newException(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException.newException(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.derby.impl.services.monitor.StorageFactoryService$10.run(Unknown Source)
    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
    at org.apache.derby.impl.services.monitor.StorageFactoryService.createServiceRoot(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.derby.impl.services.monitor.BaseMonitor.bootService(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.derby.impl.services.monitor.BaseMonitor.createPersistentService(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.derby.impl.services.monitor.FileMonitor.createPersistentService(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.derby.iapi.services.monitor.Monitor.createPersistentService(Unknown Source)
    ... 45 more

As a follow up, We probably need to see how we can support different metrics providers.   I am primarily thinking about AMS, as it is mostly available for most of the Falcon users (as it is part of Ambari) and integrated with rest of the Hadoop metrics and now with Grafana dashboards

@yzheng-hortonworks : I have figured out the issue why the exceptions are coming will remove FalconJPAService and FeedSLAMonitoritng from startup.properties as they are interdependent and we donot need both of them at the startup.Will add the required documentation how to enable the FeedSLAMonitring in a twiki.
